div.div: The wait is over! After months of development, we’ve finally released our Inupiat app that is fun, expressive visuals and includes an audio feature for fluency. “Inupiat” is a language app available on the App Store and on the Android App on Google Play.
Starting Monday, April 6, we initiated a drive thru testing clinic. By appointment only, the clinic will run Monday thru Friday from 12pm to 4pm. To meet the criteria...
div.a: Read More about ASNA Stakeholder Report April

div.div: VOICE has created a special section on their website with North Slope COVID-19 related resources. The tab will include emergency orders and resources available to North Slope residents spending more time at home along with local, state and federal legislative updates.

Enrolling New-to-District Students

Students and families who speak a language other than English can
contact Kathleen Fisher as the NSBSD Coordinator for English Language
Learners, 907-852-5311, for questions or assistance.
Students new to the district have a Home Language Survey that is
included in the enrollment packets.


Meet requirements

In order to enroll in the North Slope Borough School District for the
2019-20 school year you must meet the following requirements:

    
Kindergartners must be five years old on or before Sept. 1
    
First grade students must be six years old on or before Sept. 1



Gather documents


    
Bring the following items with you to enrollment:
    
    
Immunization Record
    
Name and address of last school attended
    
    
Birth certificate for preschool, kindergarten, and first-graders
    
    
Forms (compete the enrollment packet and additional new student forms as needed)
    
    
Tribal/Village Enrollment or Certificate of Indian Blood (if applicable)
    


Enroll


Bring the completed documents to your school to enroll
during in-person registration/enrollment. These resources will help you
locate your school: 



Click here to view school directory.","active":true,"disabled":false},{"paneId":"ctl00_ContentPlaceHolder1_ctl21_divTabs_1","title":"Elementary/Secondary Fall Registration","content":"
Elementary In-Person Fall Registration Schedule 2019-20 

In-person Registration will be held at all elementary schools for New-to-District students and all K3/K4 and Kindergartners.
If you are out of town on the start of school, please visit your school as soon as you return.

New-To-District Students (including all K3/K4 and
Kindergartners) are required to submit the following documents at
Registration:

    
Birth certificate (copy acceptable)
    
Current immunization records
    
    
Current physical and mailing address and phone numbers of students and parents
    
Names and phone numbers of emergency contacts and individuals who may pick up the child from school
    
    
Name and address of previous school attended


    
Copies of current legal papers if there is a custody agreement
    
    



Secondary In-person Fall Registration Schedule 2019-20 

In-person Registration will be held at all Secondary Schools across
the North Slope. All students must register prior to the beginning of
school:

Returning Students

May access their enrollment packet online or in-person at the school:
Families who are out of town may register at school upon their return.


New-to-the-District High School Students and In-District Transfers Grades 9-12 


Registration at your school:  In person registration will be held at
each high school. Please contact your school beginning July 22nd for
registration information.


Documents to bring for New–to-the-District students are:

    
Current immunization records
    
    
Birth certificate (copy)
    
    
Unofficial transcripts from former school
    Person other than the legal guardian who is registering children should bring proof of temporary guardianship
    
    
Current IEP and Eligibility Reports required if applicable.
    

    

    


Documents to bring for Current NSBSD students transferring schools:

    

    Anyone other than the legal guardian registering students should bring proof of temporary guardianship.

a.span: Pubic Television Resources for Children, Families and Education

div.p: Qargi.com is a multi-layered, fully immersive interactive web portal that will eventually host the vast bank of cultural knowledge and learning carried by Iñupiaq Elders, the community, and traditional archives and collections.
Click the link to visit: Qargi.com
Click the link to visit: http://viva.nsbsd.org/

Each year the State of Alaska, school districts, and individual schools publish a Report Card to the Public that summarizes the performance of each public school and its students. The North Slope Borough School District has prepared report cards for each of the 11 schools in the District, as well as a District Report Card to the Public.

Each report card includes a section addressing the following components: school/district statistics, assessments, accountability requirements, and teacher qualifications. The Report Card to the Public provides information about specific subject areas as well as subgroups.

p.a: Click here to view report cards.

br.p: District wide Children’s Christmas Card Art contest opens today which focuses on the themes: Family Traditions – Have a Merry Christmas and Happy New Year!
“Kaivinniq” - a time of celebration observed after sewing season or Winter Solstice.
With over 2000 children within the North Slope Borough, we chose a Christmas theme to initiate conversations with students about their family Christmas break traditions.

a.title: Click to view application.
a.strong: Click here to download Christmas Card Contest Application.

div.p: The staff and administration of the North Slope Borough School District (NSBSD) welcome you to our website, recently rebuilt to meet requirements for equity in access to educational services. We continue to work for our board of education in support of their vision, mission and goals as outlined in the NSBSD Strategic Plan. Our administration’s goal is to be responsive to the needs of our students, keeping safety first and striving for excellence in all that we do. The changes in the website provide a user friendly place where students, teachers, and stakeholders can get up to date information about our schools and the services we provide.

We continue to honor the decades of work that our educational leaders have contributed for our students, and look forward to strengthening our place and culture based curriculum. It is truly a joy to see the love of learning in our classrooms across the district. We all know that when we work together on behalf of our students, we are reaching for the stars as visualized on our district logo. We intend to keep our learning framework front and center and work to strengthen our partnerships with parents, grandparents, community leaders and organizations across the region to keep our schools safe and productive.
I want to thank our amazing staff for all of their hard work as we face challenges head on in a changing world environment.

div.div: 829 Aivik St, Utqiagvik, AK 99723 | Phone (907) 852-5311 | Fax (907) 852-9506
